column4: ...the use of a sensitive troponin assay in patients with suspected ACS increased the rate of diagnosis of MI and identified a high-risk group of patients...
column5: ...In patients with suspected ACS, implementation of a sensitive troponin assay increased the diagnosis of MI and identified patients at high risk of recurrent MI and death...
column8: ...A BLOOD test that detects heart attacks that would otherwise have gone undiagnosed has been hailed as a potential lifesaver by scientists…
column14: ...New test shows rise in heart attack rates...
column16: ...The team at the University of Edinburgh found that in patients admitted to hospital with chest pains, the use of a more sensitive blood test to identify heart muscle damage increased the number of patients diagnosed with a heart attack by a third...
column39: ...A BLOOD test found to better detect heart-attack risk should replace 'outdated' NHS tests to save thousands of lives…

column4: …Lowering the diagnostic threshold for MI was associated with an immediate and substantial improvement in the clinical management and outcome of patients with suspected ACS…
column5: ...Lowering the diagnostic threshold of plasma troponin was associated with major reductions in morbidity and mortality...
column6: ...After this test was introduced into clinical practice the risk of readmission to hospital with - or dying from - another heart attack within the following year was halved...
column8: ...Adopting it will substantially improve the outcome of patients with chest pain and suspected heart attack…
column14: ...More important, when the test was introduced at the Royal Infirmary of Edinburgh and the extra heart attack victims were treated it halved the risk of their being readmitted to hospital - or dying from - another heart attack within a year...
column16: ...They also found that after this test was introduced into clinical practice the risk of being readmitted to hospital with or dying from another heart attack within the following year was halved...
